sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with complex coefficients
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with complex coefficients:

\begin{aligned}
x + 2y - z &= 3 + 4i \\
3x - y + 4z &= 2 + 2i \\
2x + 3y - z &= -1 + 3i \\
\end{aligned}

where $x$, $y$, and $z$ are complex valued variables.
message_2:
To solve this system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 3+4i \\
3 & -1 & 4 & 2+2i \\
2 & 3 & -1 & -1+3i
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we will perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

1. Subtract 3 times the first row from the second row, and 2 times the first row from the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 3+4i \\
0 & -7 & 7 & -7-10i \\
0 & -1 & 1 & -7-5i
\end{array}\right]
$$

2. Multiply the second row by -1/7 and the third row by -1:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 3+4i \\
0 & 1 & -1 & 1+\frac{10}{7}i \\
0 & 1 & -1 & 7+5i
\end{array}\right]
$$

3. Subtract the second row from the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 3+4i \\
0 & 1 & -1 & 1+\frac{10}{7}i \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 6+\frac{25}{7}i
\end{array}\right]
$$

Since the third row has all zeros in the coefficient columns and a non-zero value in the constant column, this system of equations has no solution.
